contentrichtext.text: {{citations broken|date=November 2011}} '''Zakariyya Ahmad''' (1896 - 1961 in [[Egypt]]; {{lang-ar|'''زكريا أحمد'''}}) was an [[Egyptians|Egyptian]] musician and composer. He composed many pieces in a traditional [[Music of Egypt|Egyptian folk]] style. His works include solo pieces and [[film score]]s, and he composed for [[Umm Kulthum (singer)|Umm Kulthum]] beginning with a ''[[taqtuqa]]'' written in 1925. His father was Egyptian and his mother was [[Turkish people|Turkish]].<ref>{{cite book |last=Goldschmidt|first=Arthur|year=2000|title=Biographical dictionary of modern Egypt|place=|publisher=Lynne Rienner Publishers|page=17|isbn=1-55587-229-8}}</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.asmahan.com/songs/songinfo.php?File_ID=30 Recording of the composition ''Ahedni Ya Albi''] {{Authority control|VIAF=233537040}} {{Persondata | NAME = Ahmad, Zakariyya | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Musician and composer | DATE OF BIRTH = 1896 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 1961 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Ahmad, Zakariyya}} [[Category:1896 births]] [[Category:1961 deaths]] [[Category:Egyptian composers]] [[Category:Egyptian musicians]] [[Category:Egyptian people of Turkish descent]] {{Egypt-bio-stub}} {{composer-stub}}
